event_text: While batting a shiny skitter-pebble around m_c misjudged a pounce and smashed {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} tiny little snout into it.
Naive to the dangers of the sun, m_c falls asleep while sunbathing. Though {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/are/is} retrieved promptly, the young are vulerable to the desert heat.
m_c play-fought a bit too hard and got a little bruised up, panting in excitement and dehydration.
Kits are absolute thorn magnets. m_c complains loudly about {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} new scrapes.
Not every rock wall is suited for sliding down, and now m_c is not only a little scraped up but also very dirty.

Not one to make a fuss or put {PRONOUN/m_c/self} forward, m_c hasn't wanted to bother anyone. But {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} dry pads are starting to get painful as they crack, and licking them is making it worse.
The dust pile is in exactly the wrong place, and m_c skids over in a pile of flailing kitten limbs. Standing back up, {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/squawk/squawks} in pain.
The leaf-bare rains are dangerous to the unprepared and young. m_c is found, chilled and wet to the bone, after getting lost on a midnight adventure.

Greenleaf is a harsh season for childhood. m_c was outside for just a little too long, and when {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/return/returns} to the nursery, {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} little body is dangerously hot.

With the ground made slippery by the recent rains, water isn't the only thing falling. m_c slips over, and though {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} limp has mostly disappeared by the time {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/get/gets} to {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} nest, the smear of mud marrs {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} dignity.

m_c isn't as young as {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} used to be, and {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/decline/declines} giving another badger ride, ready to nap off the happy soreness that comes with being the kits' favorite chew toy at the moment.

m_c holds a cheerful conversation with r_c through the wall as {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/weave/weaves} new thorns into the nursery wall. It's not the most fun job in the world, always leaving m_c sore and tired at the end of the day despite {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} skill, but the company makes the time pass easily.
m_c hopes the pain in {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} joints foretells the rains that should be coming. Otherwise, this is just pain for no reason.
With rain has come joint pain for m_c. Stars damn it, this is why cats were made for sunny spots and clear skies. Ugh!
m_c must've landed wrong after a jump or something - {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} bones are reminding {PRONOUN/m_c/object} of {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} age. Painfully.
m_c spreads {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} limbs out in the sun, letting the desert heat bring relief to {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} old, aching joints.
Living in the desert means heavy construction materials. m_c is left aching after a day hauling rocks around camp for various purposes.
The greenleaf sun is beating down overhead, searingly hot and bright. m_c comes down with an awful headache after too much time spent outside.

This looks like being sunstruck, like m_c has stared at the noon sun too long. But m_c never did that. Visions of prophecy_list_sight are the last thing {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/remember/remembers} seeing.

event_text: The ground inside the camp has turned into a muddy mess from the rain. m_c sprains {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} paw while trying to walk through the muck.

At the border, a tiny not-cat-but-cat respects the boundary lines, turning away peacefully. m_c calls a farewell questioningly, and it replies:
Sand upon sand, the dunes have piled,
Bones beneath at peace awhiled,
Bones above the heat will bleach,
The fragile beating life will leech,
Pad at night, deny the day,
The water will show the way.

Following the sound of barking, m_c finds r_c pinned in a burrow while a dingo digs at the entrance. m_c charges in, distracting the dog for long enough to give r_c the chance to run home, though the dingo gives m_c enough of a run around that all {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} limbs ache by the time {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/collapse/collapses} into {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} nest at sunset.

history.lead_death: the venom of a copperhead snake

event_text: m_c, somewhat foolishly, pounced on a bandy-bandy after mistaking it for a Clanmate's tail. They might be fairly docile, but that was too much of an insult for any snake, and m_c is promptly bitten for it.

history.scar: m_c was scarred after pouncing on a Clanmate's tail only to discover it was a bandy-bandy snake.
history.reg_death: m_c died after pouncing on a Clanmate's tail only to discover it was a bandy-bandy snake.
history.lead_death: pounced on a Clanmate's tail only to discover it was a bandy-bandy snake

event_text: m_c steps on a snake. Neither of them are happy about it, but at least shovel-nosed coral snakes aren't dangerously venomous. Still sharp-toothed, though.

history.scar: m_c was scarred after stepping on an unfortunate shovel-nosed coral snake.
history.reg_death: m_c died after stepping on an unfortunate shovel-nosed coral snake.
history.lead_death: stepped on an unfortunate shovel-nosed coral snake

event_text: While patrolling the o_c_n borders, m_c is driven into a cactus corral by an o_c_n patrol. {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/m_c/have/has} hundreds of tiny punctures ripped into {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} pelt as {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/rip/rips} {PRONOUN/m_c/self} free.

history.scar: m_c was scarred after falling into a o_c_n trap.
history.reg_death: m_c died after falling into a o_c_n trap.
history.lead_death: died after falling into a o_c_n trap

event_text: m_c and r_c make a raid into o_c_n territory - with such huge borders, no desert Clan can watch everything. But on unfamiliar ground and in the heat of the day, the two ambitious c_n warriors find only sunstroke.

history.reg_death: m_c died from sunstroke after raiding in unfamiliar ground.
history.lead_death: got sunstroke after raiding in unfamiliar ground

event_text: Oh, gross, the full fresh-kill pile has attracted ants! m_c and r_c both get covered in indignant, biting soldier ants while trying to rescue as much of c_n's food stores as possible.

history.scar: m_c was hurt while defending the fresh-kill pile from ants.
history.reg_death: m_c died from {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} wounds after defending the fresh-kill pile from ants.
history.lead_death: {VERB/m_c/were/was} killed by ants while defending the fresh-kill pile

event_text: A gang of meerkats war-dances into camp, attracted by the fresh-kill pile. m_c is the warrior on guard duty and yowls loudly for help, bearing the brunt of the violence of the raid.

history.scar: m_c was hurt while defending the fresh-kill pile from meerkats.
history.reg_death: m_c died from {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} wounds after defending the fresh-kill pile from meerkats.
history.lead_death: {VERB/m_c/were/was} killed by meerkats while defending the fresh-kill pile
